author: dlr
msg: Rename the svn_range_dup() API to svn_merge_range_dup(), for
consistency with our existing method naming conventions (which
benefits SWIG).
* subversion/include/svn_types.h
(svn_merge_range_dup): Rename from svn_range_dup().
* subversion/libsvn_client/merge.c
(calculate_merge_ranges): Adjust for API rename.
* subversion/libsvn_subr/mergeinfo.c
(combine_with_lastrange, rangelist_intersect_or_remove): Adjust for
API rename.
(svn_merge_range_dup): Rename from svn_range_dup().
Suggested by: kou

author: dlr
msg: A follow-up to r24049.
* INSTALL: Fix dependency declaration for SQLite.

author: jerenkrantz
msg: * INSTALL: Minor copy-editing.

author: sussman
msg: * INSTALL:  remove cobwebs and give this file a major update.
- new "Audience" section to encourage average users to
use binary packages instead.
- new "Dependency Overview" section now includes zlib,
sqlite, serf, openssl, sasl, and explains whether
they're required or optional.
- add new sections for sqlite and zlib.
- warn about APR 0.9.x and 1.x binary-incompatibility issue
- warn about how this affects HTTP 2.0 vs. 2.2 as well.
- stop recommending people checkout the latest apr or
httpd source;  if they're apr or httpd devs, they'll
already know how to do this.
- list neon and serf options next to each other, rather
than putting serf as a footnote at the bottom.
- change 'Building a Server' section to not be so
blatantly HTTPD specific;  mention svnserve at the
beginning, with pointer to svnserve setup.

author: malcolm
msg: Fix the circular-dependency breakage caused by the introduction of
FSFS recovery in r23595.
Rather than allowing FSFS recovery to synthesize an fs pointer by calling
svn_fs_open() (the circular dependency), provide an explicit vtable hook for
this pseudo-open operation, and call it for all filesystems before calling
recovery with that new fs pointer.
* subversion/libsvn_fs/fs-loader.h
(fs_library_vtable_t): Add open_for_recovery(), and change recover() to
accept an fs pointer.
* subversion/libsvn_fs/fs-loader.c
(svn_fs_recover): Create a new fs pointer, open it with open_for_recovery(),
then delegate to the recover method.
* subversion/libsvn_fs_fs/fs.c
(fs_open_for_recovery): Implement, based on code removed from
svn_fs_fs__recover().
(library_vtable): Add fs_open_for_recovery().
* subversion/libsvn_fs_fs/fs_fs.c
(svn_fs_fs__path_current): Rename from path_current(), and make non-static.
(get_next_revision_ids, write_current, svn_fs_fs__create,
svn_fs_fs__set_uuid): Adjust callers of path_current().
(svn_fs_fs__recover): Accept an fs pointer rather than a path.
* subversion/libsvn_fs_fs/fs_fs.h
(svn_fs_fs__recover): Accept an fs pointer rather than a path.
(svn_fs_fs__path_current): Declare.
* subversion/libsvn_fs_base/fs.c
(base_open_for_recovery): Record the path in the partially-filled
fs pointer, for use ...
(base_bdb_recover): ... here.  Also change this to accept an fs pointer
rather than a path, to match the vtable change.
(library_vtable): Add the new open_for_recovery() vtable method.
